                              <div class="line">away with the rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALIBAN</div>
                              <div class="line">I will have none on't: we shall lose our time,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all be turn'd to barnacles, or to apes</div>
                              <div class="line">With foreheads villanous low.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Monster, lay-to your fingers: help to bear this</div>
                              <div class="line">away where my hogshead of wine is, or I'll turn you</div>
                              <div class="line">out of my kingdom: go to, carry this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TRINCULO</div>
                              <div class="line">And this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A noise of hunters heard. Enter divers Spirits,
in shape of dogs and hounds, and hunt them about,
PROSPERO and ARIEL setting them on</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hey, Mountain, hey!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Silver I there it goes, Silver!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fury, Fury! there, Tyrant, there! hark! hark!</div>
                              <p>CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO, are
driven out</p>
                              <div class="line">Go charge my goblins that they grind their joints</div>
                              <div class="line">With dry convulsions, shorten up their sinews</div>
                              <div class="line">With aged cramps, and more pinch-spotted make them</div>
                              <div class="line">Than pard or cat o' mountain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark, they roar!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them be hunted soundly. At this hour</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie at my mercy all mine enemies:</div>
                              <div class="line">Shortly shall all my labours end, and thou</div>
                              <div class="line">Shalt have the air at freedom: for a little</div>
                              <div class="line">Follow, and do me service.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Before PROSPERO'S cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. EPILOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before PROSPERO'S cell.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PROSPERO in his magic robes, and ARIEL</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now does my project gather to a head:</div>
                              <div class="line">My charms crack not; my spirits obey; and time</div>
                              <div class="line">Goes upright with his carriage. How's the day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">On the sixth hour; at which time, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">You said our work should cease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">I did say so,</div>
                              <div class="line">When first I raised the tempest. Say, my spirit,</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares the king and's followers?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Confined together</div>
                              <div class="line">In the same fashion as you gave in charge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Just as you left them; all prisoners, sir,</div>
                              <div class="line">In the line-grove which weather-fends your cell;</div>
                              <div class="line">They cannot budge till your release. The king,</div>
                              <div class="line">His brother and yours, abide all three distracted</div>
                              <div class="line">And the remainder mourning over them,</div>
                              <div class="line">Brimful of sorrow and dismay; but chiefly</div>
                              <div class="line">Him that you term'd, sir, 'The good old lord Gonzalo;'</div>
                              <div class="line">His tears run down his beard, like winter's drops</div>
                              <div class="line">From eaves of reeds. Your charm so strongly works 'em</div>
                              <div class="line">That if you now beheld them, your affections</div>
                              <div class="line">Would become tender.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou think so, spirit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine would, sir, were I human.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">And mine shall.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou, which art but air, a touch, a feeling</div>
                              <div class="line">Of their afflictions, and shall not myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">One of their kind, that relish all as sharply,</div>
                              <div class="line">Passion as they, be kindlier moved than thou art?</div>
                              <div class="line">Though with their high wrongs I am struck to the quick,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet with my nobler reason 'gaitist my fury</div>
                              <div class="line">Do I take part: the rarer action is</div>
                              <div class="line">In virtue than in vengeance: they being penitent,</div>
                              <div class="line">The sole drift of my purpose doth extend</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a frown further. Go release them, Ariel:</div>
                              <div class="line">My charms I'll break, their senses I'll restore,</div>
                              <div class="line">And they shall be themselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll fetch them, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ye elves of hills, brooks, standing lakes and groves,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ye that on the sands with printless foot</div>
                              <div class="line">Do chase the ebbing Neptune and do fly him</div>
                              <div class="line">When he comes back; you demi-puppets that</div>
                              <div class="line">By moonshine do the green sour ringlets make,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereof the ewe not bites, and you whose pastime</div>
                              <div class="line">Is to make midnight mushrooms, that rejoice</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear the solemn curfew; by whose aid,</div>
                              <div class="line">Weak masters though ye be, I have bedimm'd</div>
                              <div class="line">The noontide sun, call'd forth the mutinous winds,</div>
                              <div class="line">And 'twixt the green sea and the azured vault</div>
                              <div class="line">Set roaring war: to the dread rattling thunder</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I given fire and rifted Jove's stout oak</div>
                              <div class="line">With his own bolt; the strong-based promontory</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I made shake and by the spurs pluck'd up</div>
                              <div class="line">The pine and cedar: graves at my command</div>
                              <div class="line">Have waked their sleepers, oped, and let 'em forth</div>
                              <div class="line">By my so potent art. But this rough magic</div>
                              <div class="line">I here abjure, and, when I have required</div>
                              <div class="line">Some heavenly music, which even now I do,</div>
                              <div class="line">To work mine end upon their senses that</div>
                              <div class="line">This airy charm is for, I'll break my staff,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bury it certain fathoms in the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">And deeper than did ever plummet sound</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll drown my book.</div>
                              <p>Solemn music</p>
                              <p>Re-enter ARIEL before: then ALONSO, with a
frantic gesture, attended by GONZALO;
SEBASTIAN and ANTONIO in like manner,
attended by ADRIAN and FRANCISCO   they all
enter the circle which PROSPERO had made,
and there stand charmed; which PROSPERO
observing, speaks:</p>
                              <div class="line">A solemn air and the best comforter</div>
                              <div class="line">To an unsettled fancy cure thy brains,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now useless, boil'd within thy skull! There stand,</div>
                              <div class="line">For you are spell-stopp'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">Holy Gonzalo, honourable man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine eyes, even sociable to the show of thine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fall fellowly drops. The charm dissolves apace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And as the morning steals upon the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Melting the darkness, so their rising senses</div>
                              <div class="line">Begin to chase the ignorant fumes that mantle</div>
                              <div class="line">Their clearer reason. O good Gonzalo,</div>
                              <div class="line">My true preserver, and a loyal sir</div>
                              <div class="line">To him you follow'st! I will pay thy graces</div>
                              <div class="line">Home both in word and deed. Most cruelly</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst thou, Alonso, use me and my daughter:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy brother was a furtherer in the act.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art pinch'd fort now, Sebastian. Flesh and blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">You, brother mine, that entertain'd ambition,</div>
                              <div class="line">Expell'd remorse and nature; who, with Sebastian,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose inward pinches therefore are most strong,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would here have kill'd your king; I do forgive thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unnatural though thou art. Their understanding</div>
                              <div class="line">Begins to swell, and the approaching tide</div>
                              <div class="line">Will shortly fill the reasonable shore</div>
                              <div class="line">That now lies foul and muddy. Not one of them</div>
                              <div class="line">That yet looks on me, or would know me Ariel,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fetch me the hat and rapier in my cell:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will discase me, and myself present</div>
                              <div class="line">As I was sometime Milan: quickly, spirit;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shalt ere long be free.</div>
                              <p>ARIEL sings and helps to attire him</p>
                              <div class="line">Where the bee sucks. there suck I:</div>
                              <div class="line">In a cowslip's bell I lie;</div>
                              <div class="line">There I couch when owls do cry.</div>
                              <div class="line">On the bat's back I do fly</div>
                              <div class="line">After summer merrily.</div>
                              <div class="line">Merrily, merrily shall I live now</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the blossom that hangs on the bough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that's my dainty Ariel! I shall miss thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet thou shalt have freedom: so, so, so.</div>
                              <div class="line">To the king's ship, invisible as thou art:</div>
                              <div class="line">There shalt thou find the mariners asleep</div>
                              <div class="line">Under the hatches; the master and the boatswain</div>
                              <div class="line">Being awake, enforce them to this place,</div>
                              <div class="line">And presently, I prithee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">I drink the air before me, and return</div>
                              <div class="line">Or ere your pulse twice beat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONZALO</div>
                              <div class="line">All torment, trouble, wonder and amazement</div>
                              <div class="line">Inhabits here: some heavenly power guide us</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of this fearful country!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold, sir king,</div>
                              <div class="line">The wronged Duke of Milan, Prospero:</div>
                              <div class="line">For more assurance that a living prince</div>
                              <div class="line">Does now speak to thee, I embrace thy body;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to thee and thy company I bid</div>
                              <div class="line">A hearty welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether thou best he or no,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or some enchanted trifle to abuse me,</div>
                              <div class="line">As late I have been, I not know: thy pulse</div>
                              <div class="line">Beats as of flesh and blood; and, since I saw thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">The affliction of my mind amends, with which,</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear, a madness held me: this must crave,</div>
                              <div class="line">An if this be at all, a most strange story.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy dukedom I resign and do entreat</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou pardon me my wrongs. But how should Prospero</div>
                              <div class="line">Be living and be here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">First, noble friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me embrace thine age, whose honour cannot</div>
                              <div class="line">Be measured or confined.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONZALO</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether this be</div>
                              <div class="line">Or be not, I'll not swear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">You do yet taste</div>
                              <div class="line">Some subtilties o' the isle, that will not let you</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe things certain. Welcome, my friends all!</div>
                              <p>Aside to SEBASTIAN and ANTONIO</p>
                              <div class="line">But you, my brace of lords, were I so minded,</div>
                              <div class="line">I here could pluck his highness' frown upon you</div>
                              <div class="line">And justify you traitors: at this time</div>
                              <div class="line">I will tell no tales.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  The devil speaks in him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                              <div class="line">For you, most wicked sir, whom to call brother</div>
                              <div class="line">Would even infect my mouth, I do forgive</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy rankest fault; all of them; and require</div>
                              <div class="line">My dukedom of thee, which perforce, I know,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou must restore.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou be'st Prospero,</div>
                              <div class="line">Give us particulars of thy preservation;</div>
                              <div class="line">How thou hast met us here, who three hours since</div>
                              <div class="line">Were wreck'd upon this shore; where I have lost--</div>
                              <div class="line">How sharp the point of this remembrance is!--</div>
                              <div class="line">My dear son Ferdinand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am woe for't, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">Irreparable is the loss, and patience</div>
                              <div class="line">Says it is past her cure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">I rather think</div>
                              <div class="line">You have not sought her help, of whose soft grace</div>
                              <div class="line">For the like loss I have her sovereign aid</div>
                              <div class="line">And rest myself content.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">You the like loss!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">As great to me as late; and, supportable</div>
                              <div class="line">To make the dear loss, have I means much weaker</div>
                              <div class="line">Than you may call to comfort you, for I</div>
                              <div class="line">Have lost my daughter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">A daughter?</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavens, that they were living both in Naples,</div>
                              <div class="line">The king and queen there! that they were, I wish</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself were mudded in that oozy bed</div>
                              <div class="line">Where my son lies. When did you lose your daughter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">In this last tempest. I perceive these lords</div>
                              <div class="line">At this encounter do so much admire</div>
                              <div class="line">That they devour their reason and scarce think</div>
                              <div class="line">Their eyes do offices of truth, their words</div>
                              <div class="line">Are natural breath: but, howsoe'er you have</div>
                              <div class="line">Been justled from your senses, know for certain</div>
                              <div class="line">That I am Prospero and that very duke</div>
                              <div class="line">Which was thrust forth of Milan, who most strangely</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon this shore, where you were wreck'd, was landed,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be the lord on't. No more yet of this;</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'tis a chronicle of day by day,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a relation for a breakfast nor</div>
                              <div class="line">Befitting this first meeting. Welcome, sir;</div>
                              <div class="line">This cell's my court: here have I few attendants</div>
                              <div class="line">And subjects none abroad: pray you, look in.</div>
                              <div class="line">My dukedom since you have given me again,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will requite you with as good a thing;</div>
                              <div class="line">At least bring forth a wonder, to content ye</div>
                              <div class="line">As much as me my dukedom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Here PROSPERO discovers FERDINAND and MIRANDA
playing at chess</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MIRANDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet lord, you play me false.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my dear'st love,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not for the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MIRANDA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, for a score of kingdoms you should wrangle,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I would call it, fair play.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">If this prove</div>
                              <div class="line">A vision of the Island, one dear son</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I twice lose.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">A most high miracle!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Though the seas threaten, they are merciful;</div>
                              <div class="line">I have cursed them without cause.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Kneels</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now all the blessings</div>
                              <div class="line">Of a glad father compass thee about!</div>
                              <div class="line">Arise, and say how thou camest here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MIRANDA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, wonder!</div>
                              <div class="line">How many goodly creatures are there here!</div>
                              <div class="line">How beauteous mankind is! O brave new world,</div>
                              <div class="line">That has such people in't!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis new to thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">What is this maid with whom thou wast at play?</div>
                              <div class="line">Your eld'st acquaintance cannot be three hours:</div>
                              <div class="line">Is she the goddess that hath sever'd us,</div>
                              <div class="line">And brought us thus together?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, she is mortal;</div>
                              <div class="line">But by immortal Providence she's mine:</div>
                              <div class="line">I chose her when I could not ask my father</div>
                              <div class="line">For his advice, nor thought I had one. She</div>
                              <div class="line">Is daughter to this famous Duke of Milan,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of whom so often I have heard renown,</div>
                              <div class="line">But never saw before; of whom I have</div>
                              <div class="line">Received a second life; and second father</div>
                              <div class="line">This lady makes him to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am hers:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, O, how oddly will it sound that I</div>
                              <div class="line">Must ask my child forgiveness!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">There, sir, stop:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us not burthen our remembrance with</div>
                              <div class="line">A heaviness that's gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONZALO</div>
                              <div class="line">I have inly wept,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or should have spoke ere this. Look down, you god,</div>
                              <div class="line">And on this couple drop a blessed crown!</div>
                              <div class="line">For it is you that have chalk'd forth the way</div>
                              <div class="line">Which brought us hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">I say, Amen, Gonzalo!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONZALO</div>
                              <div class="line">Was Milan thrust from Milan, that his issue</div>
                              <div class="line">Should become kings of Naples? O, rejoice</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond a common joy, and set it down</div>
                              <div class="line">With gold on lasting pillars: In one voyage</div>
                              <div class="line">Did Claribel her husband find at Tunis,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Ferdinand, her brother, found a wife</div>
                              <div class="line">Where he himself was lost, Prospero his dukedom</div>
                              <div class="line">In a poor isle and all of us ourselves</div>
                              <div class="line">When no man was his own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To FERDINAND and MIRANDA</span>  Give me your hands:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let grief and sorrow still embrace his heart</div>
                              <div class="line">That doth not wish you joy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GONZALO</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it so! Amen!</div>
                              <p>Re-enter ARIEL, with the Master and Boatswain
amazedly following</p>
                              <div class="line">O, look, sir, look, sir! here is more of us:</div>
                              <div class="line">I prophesied, if a gallows were on land,</div>
                              <div class="line">This fellow could not drown. Now, blasphemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">That swear'st grace o'erboard, not an oath on shore?</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou no mouth by land? What is the news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boatswain</div>
                              <div class="line">The best news is, that we have safely found</div>
                              <div class="line">Our king and company; the next, our ship--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, but three glasses since, we gave out split--</div>
                              <div class="line">Is tight and yare and bravely rigg'd as when</div>
                              <div class="line">We first put out to sea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to PROSPERO</span>  Sir, all this service</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I done since I went.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to ARIEL</span>  My tricksy spirit!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">These are not natural events; they strengthen</div>
                              <div class="line">From strange to stranger. Say, how came you hither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boatswain</div>
                              <div class="line">If I did think, sir, I were well awake,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'ld strive to tell you. We were dead of sleep,</div>
                              <div class="line">And--how we know not--all clapp'd under hatches;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where but even now with strange and several noises</div>
                              <div class="line">Of roaring, shrieking, howling, jingling chains,</div>
                              <div class="line">And more diversity of sounds, all horrible,</div>
                              <div class="line">We were awaked; straightway, at liberty;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where we, in all her trim, freshly beheld</div>
                              <div class="line">Our royal, good and gallant ship, our master</div>
                              <div class="line">Capering to eye her: on a trice, so please you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in a dream, were we divided from them</div>
                              <div class="line">And were brought moping hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARIEL</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to PROSPERO</span>          Was't well done?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to ARIEL</span>  Bravely, my diligence. Thou shalt be free.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">This is as strange a maze as e'er men trod</div>
                              <div class="line">And there is in this business more than nature</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever conduct of: some oracle</div>
                              <div class="line">Must rectify our knowledge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, my liege,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not infest your mind with beating on</div>
                              <div class="line">The strangeness of this business; at pick'd leisure</div>
                              <div class="line">Which shall be shortly, single I'll resolve you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which to you shall seem probable, of every</div>
                              <div class="line">These happen'd accidents; till when, be cheerful</div>
                              <div class="line">And think of each thing well.</div>
                              <p>Aside to ARIEL</p>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, spirit:</div>
                              <div class="line">Set Caliban and his companions free;</div>
                              <div class="line">Untie the spell.</div>
                              <p>Exit ARIEL</p>
                              <div class="line">How fares my gracious sir?</div>
                              <div class="line">There are yet missing of your company</div>
                              <div class="line">Some few odd lads that you remember not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter ARIEL, driving in CALIBAN, STEPHANO
and TRINCULO, in their stolen apparel</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Every man shift for all the rest, and</div>
                              <div class="line">let no man take care for himself; for all is</div>
                              <div class="line">but fortune. Coragio, bully-monster, coragio!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TRINCULO</div>
                              <div class="line">If these be true spies which I wear in my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">here's a goodly sight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALIBAN</div>
                              <div class="line">O Setebos, these be brave spirits indeed!</div>
                              <div class="line">How fine my master is! I am afraid</div>
                              <div class="line">He will chastise me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha, ha!</div>
                              <div class="line">What things are these, my lord Antonio?</div>
                              <div class="line">Will money buy 'em?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Very like; one of them</div>
                              <div class="line">Is a plain fish, and, no doubt, marketable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark but the badges of these men, my lords,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then say if they be true. This mis-shapen knave,</div>
                              <div class="line">His mother was a witch, and one so strong</div>
                              <div class="line">That could control the moon, make flows and ebbs,</div>
                              <div class="line">And deal in her command without her power.</div>
                              <div class="line">These three have robb'd me; and this demi-devil--</div>
                              <div class="line">For he's a bastard one--had plotted with them</div>
                              <div class="line">To take my life. Two of these fellows you</div>
                              <div class="line">Must know and own; this thing of darkness!</div>
                              <div class="line">Acknowledge mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALIBAN</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall be pinch'd to death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not this Stephano, my drunken butler?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">He is drunk now: where had he wine?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">And Trinculo is reeling ripe: where should they</div>
                              <div class="line">Find this grand liquor that hath gilded 'em?</div>
                              <div class="line">How camest thou in this pickle?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TRINCULO</div>
                              <div class="line">I have been in such a pickle since I</div>
                              <div class="line">saw you last that, I fear me, will never out of</div>
                              <div class="line">my bones: I shall not fear fly-blowing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, how now, Stephano!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, touch me not; I am not Stephano, but a cramp.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">You'ld be king o' the isle, sirrah?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">I should have been a sore one then.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">This is a strange thing as e'er I look'd on.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Pointing to Caliban</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is as disproportion'd in his manners</div>
                              <div class="line">As in his shape. Go, sirrah, to my cell;</div>
                              <div class="line">Take with you your companions; as you look</div>
                              <div class="line">To have my pardon, trim it handsomely.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CALIBAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that I will; and I'll be wise hereafter</div>
                              <div class="line">And seek for grace. What a thrice-double ass</div>
                              <div class="line">Was I, to take this drunkard for a god</div>
                              <div class="line">And worship this dull fool!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to; away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hence, and bestow your luggage where you found it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SEBASTIAN</div>
                              <div class="line">Or stole it, rather.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I invite your highness and your train</div>
                              <div class="line">To my poor cell, where you shall take your rest</div>
                              <div class="line">For this one night; which, part of it, I'll waste</div>
                              <div class="line">With such discourse as, I not doubt, shall make it</div>
                              <div class="line">Go quick away; the story of my life</div>
                              <div class="line">And the particular accidents gone by</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I came to this isle: and in the morn</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll bring you to your ship and so to Naples,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I have hope to see the nuptial</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these our dear-beloved solemnized;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thence retire me to my Milan, where</div>
                              <div class="line">Every third thought shall be my grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALONSO</div>
                              <div class="line">I long</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear the story of your life, which must</div>
                              <div class="line">Take the ear strangely.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PROSPERO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll deliver all;</div>
                              <div class="line">And promise you calm seas, auspicious gales</div>
                              <div class="line">And sail so expeditious that shall catch</div>
                              <div class="line">Your royal fleet far off.</div>
                              <p>Aside to ARIEL</p>
                              <div class="line">My Ariel, chick,</div>
                              <div class="line">That is thy charge: then to the elements</div>
                              <div class="line">Be free, and fare thou well! Please you, draw near.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. EPILOGUE</h2>
                        <h4>SPOKEN BY PROSPERO</h4>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">[PROSPERO]</div>
                              <div class="line">Now my charms are all o'erthrown,</div>
                              <div class="line">And what strength I have's mine own,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is most faint: now, 'tis true,</div>
                              <div class="line">I must be here confined by you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or sent to Naples. Let me not,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have my dukedom got</div>
                              <div class="line">And pardon'd the deceiver, dwell</div>
                              <div class="line">In this bare island by your spell;</div>
                              <div class="line">But release me from my bands</div>
                              <div class="line">With the help of your good hands:</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentle breath of yours my sails</div>
                              <div class="line">Must fill, or else my project fails,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which was to please. Now I want</div>
                              <div class="line">Spirits to enforce, art to enchant,</div>
                              <div class="line">And my ending is despair,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless I be relieved by prayer,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which pierces so that it assaults</div>
                              <div class="line">Mercy itself and frees all faults.</div>
                              <div class="line">As you from crimes would pardon'd be,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let your indulgence set me free.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
The “current” CSS styling is applied to the this entire document; the results in this column may be anomalous. Also, image links are broken in this column. 

The Tempest

Table of Contents

  • 1. Dramatis Personae
  • 1. ACT I
    • 1. SCENE I. On a ship at sea: a tempestuous noise of thunder and lightning heard.
    • 2. SCENE II. The island. Before PROSPERO'S cell.
  • 2. ACT II
    • 1. SCENE I. Another part of the island.
    • 2. SCENE II. Another part of the island.
  • 3. ACT III
    • 1. SCENE I. Before PROSPERO'S Cell.
    • 2. SCENE II. Another part of the island.
    • 3. SCENE III. Another part of the island.
  • 4. ACT IV
    • 1. SCENE I. Before PROSPERO'S cell.
  • 5. ACT V
    • 1. SCENE I. Before PROSPERO'S cell.
    • 2. EPILOGUE

Dramatis Personae

ALONSO, King of Naples.

SEBASTIAN, his brother.

PROSPERO, the right Duke of Milan.

ANTONIO, his brother, the usurping Duke of Milan.

FERDINAND, son to the King of Naples.

GONZALO, an honest old Counsellor.

ADRIAN FRANCISCO Lords.

CALIBAN, a savage and deformed Slave.

TRINCULO, a Jester.

STEPHANO, a drunken Butler.

Master of a Ship.

Boatswain.

Mariners.

MIRANDA, daughter to Prospero.

ARIEL, an airy Spirit.

IRIS CERES JUNO Nymphs Reapers presented by Spirits.

Other Spirits attending on Prospero.

SCENE A ship at Sea: an island.

Chapter 1. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. On a ship at sea: a tempestuous noise of thunder and lightning heard.
  • 2. SCENE II. The island. Before PROSPERO'S cell.

1. SCENE I. On a ship at sea: a tempestuous noise of thunder and lightning heard.

Enter a Master and a Boatswain

Master
Boatswain!
Boatswain
Here, master: what cheer?
Master
Good, speak to the mariners: fall to't, yarely,
or we run ourselves aground: bestir, bestir.

Exit

Enter Mariners

Boatswain
Heigh, my hearts! cheerly, cheerly, my hearts!
yare, yare! Take in the topsail. Tend to the
master's whistle. Blow, till thou burst thy wind,
if room enough!

Enter ALONSO, SEBASTIAN, ANTONIO, FERDINAND, GONZALO, and others

ALONSO
Good boatswain, have care. Where's the master?
Play the men.
Boatswain
I pray now, keep below.
ANTONIO
Where is the master, boatswain?
Boatswain
Do you not hear him? You mar our labour: keep your
cabins: you do assist the storm.
GONZALO
Nay, good, be patient.
Boatswain
When the sea is. Hence! What cares these roarers
for the name of king? To cabin: silence! trouble us not.
GONZALO
Good, yet remember whom thou hast aboard.
Boatswain
None that I more love than myself. You are a
counsellor; if you can command these elements to
silence, and work the peace of the present, we will
not hand a rope more; use your authority: if you
cannot, give thanks you have lived so long, and make
yourself ready in your cabin for the mischance of
the hour, if it so hap. Cheerly, good hearts! Out
of our way, I say.

Exit

GONZALO
I have great comfort from this fellow: methinks he
hath no drowning mark upon him; his complexion is
perfect gallows. Stand fast, good Fate, to his
hanging: make the rope of his destiny our cable,
for our own doth little advantage. If he be not
born to be hanged, our case is miserable.

Exeunt

Re-enter Boatswain

Boatswain
Down with the topmast! yare! lower, lower! Bring
her to try with main-course.

A cry within

A plague upon this howling! they are louder than
the weather or our office.

Re-enter SEBASTIAN, ANTONIO, and GONZALO

Yet again! what do you here? Shall we give o'er
and drown? Have you a mind to sink?
SEBASTIAN
A pox o' your throat, you bawling, blasphemous,
incharitable dog!
Boatswain
Work you then.
ANTONIO
Hang, cur! hang, you whoreson, insolent noisemaker!
We are less afraid to be drowned than thou art.
GONZALO
I'll warrant him for drowning; though the ship were
no stronger than a nutshell and as leaky as an
unstanched wench.
Boatswain
Lay her a-hold, a-hold! set her two courses off to
sea again; lay her off.

Enter Mariners wet

Mariners
All lost! to prayers, to prayers! all lost!
Boatswain
What, must our mouths be cold?
GONZALO
The king and prince at prayers! let's assist them,
For our case is as theirs.
SEBASTIAN
I'm out of patience.
ANTONIO
We are merely cheated of our lives by drunkards:
This wide-chapp'd rascal--would thou mightst lie drowning
The washing of ten tides!
GONZALO
He'll be hang'd yet,
Though every drop of water swear against it
And gape at widest to glut him.

A confused noise within: 'Mercy on us!'-- 'We split, we split!'--'Farewell, my wife and children!'-- 'Farewell, brother!'--'We split, we split, we split!'

ANTONIO
Let's all sink with the king.
SEBASTIAN
Let's take leave of him.

Exeunt ANTONIO and SEBASTIAN

GONZALO
Now would I give a thousand furlongs of sea for an
acre of barren ground, long heath, brown furze, any
thing. The wills above be done! but I would fain
die a dry death.

Exeunt

2. SCENE II. The island. Before PROSPERO'S cell.

Enter PROSPERO and MIRANDA

MIRANDA
If by your art, my dearest father, you have
Put the wild waters in this roar, allay them.
The sky, it seems, would pour down stinking pitch,
But that the sea, mounting to the welkin's cheek,
Dashes the fire out. O, I have suffered
With those that I saw suffer: a brave vessel,
Who had, no doubt, some noble creature in her,
Dash'd all to pieces. O, the cry did knock
Against my very heart. Poor souls, they perish'd.
Had I been any god of power, I would
Have sunk the sea within the earth or ere
It should the good ship so have swallow'd and
The fraughting souls within her.
PROSPERO
Be collected:
No more amazement: tell your piteous heart
There's no harm done.
MIRANDA
O, woe the day!
PROSPERO
No harm.
I have done nothing but in care of thee,
Of thee, my dear one, thee, my daughter, who
Art ignorant of what thou art, nought knowing
Of whence I am, nor that I am more better
Than Prospero, master of a full poor cell,
And thy no greater father.
MIRANDA
More to know
Did never meddle with my thoughts.
PROSPERO
'Tis time
I should inform thee farther. Lend thy hand,
And pluck my magic garment from me. So:

Lays down his mantle

Lie there, my art. Wipe thou thine eyes; have comfort.
The direful spectacle of the wreck, which touch'd
The very virtue of compassion in thee,
I have with such provision in mine art
So safely ordered that there is no soul--
No, not so much perdition as an hair
Betid to any creature in the vessel
Which thou heard'st cry, which thou saw'st sink. Sit down;
For thou must now know farther.
MIRANDA
You have often
Begun to tell me what I am, but stopp'd
And left me to a bootless inquisition,
Concluding 'Stay: not yet.'
PROSPERO
The hour's now come;
The very minute bids thee ope thine ear;
Obey and be attentive. Canst thou remember
A time before we came unto this cell?
I do not think thou canst, for then thou wast not
Out three years old.
MIRANDA
Certainly, sir, I can.
PROSPERO
By what? by any other house or person?
Of any thing the image tell me that
Hath kept with thy remembrance.
MIRANDA
'Tis far off
And rather like a dream than an assurance
That my remembrance warrants. Had I not
Four or five women once that tended me?
PROSPERO
Thou hadst, and more, Miranda. But how is it
That this lives in thy mind? What seest thou else
In the dark backward and abysm of time?
If thou remember'st aught ere thou camest here,
How thou camest here thou mayst.
MIRANDA
But that I do not.
PROSPERO
Twelve year since, Miranda, twelve year since,
Thy father was the Duke of Milan and
A prince of power.
MIRANDA
Sir, are not you my father?
PROSPERO
Thy mother was a piece of virtue, and
She said thou wast my daughter; and thy father
Was Duke of Milan; and thou his only heir
And princess no worse issued.
MIRANDA
O the heavens!
What foul play had we, that we came from thence?
Or blessed was't we did?
PROSPERO
Both, both, my girl:
By foul play, as thou say'st, were we heaved thence,
But blessedly holp hither.
MIRANDA
O, my heart bleeds
To think o' the teen that I have turn'd you to,
Which is from my remembrance! Please you, farther.
PROSPERO
My brother and thy uncle, call'd Antonio--
I pray thee, mark me--that a brother should
Be so perfidious!--he whom next thyself
Of all the world I loved and to him put
The manage of my state; as at that time
Through all the signories it was the first
And Prospero the prime duke, being so reputed
In dignity, and for the liberal arts
Without a parallel; those being all my study,
The government I cast upon my brother
And to my state grew stranger, being transported
And rapt in secret studies. Thy false uncle--
Dost thou attend me?
MIRANDA
Sir, most heedfully.
PROSPERO
Being once perfected how to grant suits,
How to deny them, who to advance and who
To trash for over-topping, new created
The creatures that were mine, I say, or changed 'em,
Or else new form'd 'em; having both the key
Of officer and office, set all hearts i' the state
To what tune pleased his ear; that now he was
The ivy which had hid my princely trunk,
And suck'd my verdure out on't. Thou attend'st not.
MIRANDA
O, good sir, I do.
PROSPERO
I pray thee, mark me.
I, thus neglecting worldly ends, all dedicated
To closeness and the bettering of my mind
With that which, but by being so retired,
O'er-prized all popular rate, in my false brother
Awaked an evil nature; and my trust,
Like a good parent, did beget of him
A falsehood in its contrary as great
As my trust was; which had indeed no limit,
A confidence sans bound. He being thus lorded,
Not only with what my revenue yielded,
But what my power might else exact, like one
Who having into truth, by telling of it,
Made such a sinner of his memory,
To credit his own lie, he did believe
He was indeed the duke; out o' the substitution
And executing the outward face of royalty,
With all prerogative: hence his ambition growing--
Dost thou hear?
MIRANDA
Your tale, sir, would cure deafness.
PROSPERO
To have no screen between this part he play'd
And him he play'd it for, he needs will be
Absolute Milan. Me, poor man, my library
Was dukedom large enough: of temporal royalties
He thinks me now incapable; confederates--
So dry he was for sway--wi' the King of Naples
To give him annual tribute, do him homage,
Subject his coronet to his crown and bend
The dukedom yet unbow'd--alas, poor Milan!--
To most ignoble stooping.
MIRANDA
O the heavens!
PROSPERO
Mark his condition and the event; then tell me
If this might be a brother.
MIRANDA
I should sin
To think but nobly of my grandmother:
Good wombs have borne bad sons.
PROSPERO
Now the condition.
The King of Naples, being an enemy
To me inveterate, hearkens my brother's suit;
Which was, that he, in lieu o' the premises
Of homage and I know not how much tribute,
Should presently extirpate me and mine
Out of the dukedom and confer fair Milan
With all the honours on my brother: whereon,
A treacherous army levied, one midnight
Fated to the purpose did Antonio open
The gates of Milan, and, i' the dead of darkness,
The ministers for the purpose hurried thence
Me and thy crying self.
MIRANDA
Alack, for pity!
I, not remembering how I cried out then,
Will cry it o'er again: it is a hint
That wrings mine eyes to't.
PROSPERO
Hear a little further
And then I'll bring thee to the present business
Which now's upon's; without the which this story
Were most impertinent.
MIRANDA
Wherefore did they not
That hour destroy us?
PROSPERO
Well demanded, wench:
My tale provokes that question. Dear, they durst not,
So dear the love my people bore me, nor set
A mark so bloody on the business, but
With colours fairer painted their foul ends.
In few, they hurried us aboard a bark,
Bore us some leagues to sea; where they prepared
A rotten carcass of a boat, not rigg'd,
Nor tackle, sail, nor mast; the very rats
Instinctively had quit it: there they hoist us,
To cry to the sea that roar'd to us, to sigh
To the winds whose pity, sighing back again,
Did us but loving wrong.
MIRANDA
Alack, what trouble
Was I then to you!
PROSPERO
O, a cherubim
Thou wast that did preserve me. Thou didst smile.
Infused with a fortitude from heaven,
When I have deck'd the sea with drops full salt,
Under my burthen groan'd; which raised in me
An undergoing stomach, to bear up
Against what should ensue.
MIRANDA
How came we ashore?
PROSPERO
By Providence divine.
Some food we had and some fresh water that
A noble Neapolitan, Gonzalo,
Out of his charity, being then appointed
Master of this design, did give us, with
Rich garments, linens, stuffs and necessaries,
Which since have steaded much; so, of his gentleness,
Knowing I loved my books, he furnish'd me
From mine own library with volumes that
I prize above my dukedom.
MIRANDA
Would I might
But ever see that man!
PROSPERO
Now I arise:

Resumes his mantle

Sit still, and hear the last of our sea-sorrow.
Here in this island we arrived; and here
Have I, thy schoolmaster, made thee more profit
Than other princesses can that have more time
For vainer hours and tutors not so careful.
MIRANDA
Heavens thank you for't! And now, I pray you, sir,
For still 'tis beating in my mind, your reason
For raising this sea-storm?
PROSPERO
Know thus far forth.
By accident most strange, bountiful Fortune,
Now my dear lady, hath mine enemies
Brought to this shore; and by my prescience
I find my zenith doth depend upon
A most auspicious star, whose influence
If now I court not but omit, my fortunes
Will ever after droop. Here cease more questions:
Thou art inclined to sleep; 'tis a good dulness,
And give it way: I know thou canst not choose.

MIRANDA sleeps

Come away, servant, come. I am ready now.
Approach, my Ariel, come.

Enter ARIEL

ARIEL
All hail, great master! grave sir, hail! I come
To answer thy best pleasure; be't to fly,
To swim, to dive into the fire, to ride
On the curl'd clouds, to thy strong bidding task
Ariel and all his quality.
PROSPERO
Hast thou, spirit,
Perform'd to point the tempest that I bade thee?
ARIEL
To every article.
I boarded the king's ship; now on the beak,
Now in the waist, the deck, in every cabin,
I flamed amazement: sometime I'ld divide,
And burn in many places; on the topmast,
The yards and bowsprit, would I flame distinctly,
Then meet and join. Jove's lightnings, the precursors
O' the dreadful thunder-claps, more momentary
And sight-outrunning were not; the fire and cracks
Of sulphurous roaring the most mighty Neptune
Seem to besiege and make his bold waves tremble,
Yea, his dread trident shake.
PROSPERO
My brave spirit!
Who was so firm, so constant, that this coil
Would not infect his reason?
ARIEL
Not a soul
But felt a fever of the mad and play'd
Some tricks of desperation. All but mariners
Plunged in the foaming brine and quit the vessel,
Then all afire with me: the king's son, Ferdinand,
With hair up-staring,--then like reeds, not hair,--
Was the first man that leap'd; cried, 'Hell is empty
And all the devils are here.'
PROSPERO
Why that's my spirit!
But was not this nigh shore?
ARIEL
Close by, my master.
PROSPERO
But are they, Ariel, safe?
ARIEL
Not a hair perish'd;
On their sustaining garments not a blemish,
But fresher than before: and, as thou badest me,
In troops I have dispersed them 'bout the isle.
The king's son have I landed by himself;
Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs
In an odd angle of the isle and sitting,
His arms in this sad knot.
PROSPERO
Of the king's ship
The mariners say how thou hast disposed
And all the rest o' the fleet.
ARIEL
Safely in harbour
Is the king's ship; in the deep nook, where once
Thou call'dst me up at midnight to fetch dew
From the still-vex'd Bermoothes, there she's hid:
The mariners all under hatches stow'd;
Who, with a charm join'd to their suffer'd labour,
I have left asleep; and for the rest o' the fleet
Which I dispersed, they all have met again
And are upon the Mediterranean flote,
Bound sadly home for Naples,
Supposing that they saw the king's ship wreck'd
And his great person perish.
PROSPERO
Ariel, thy charge
Exactly is perform'd: but there's more work.
What is the time o' the day?
ARIEL
Past the mid season.
PROSPERO
At least two glasses. The time 'twixt six and now
Must by us both be spent most preciously.
ARIEL
Is there more toil? Since thou dost give me pains,
Let me remember thee what thou hast promised,
Which is not yet perform'd me.
PROSPERO
How now? moody?
What is't thou canst demand?
ARIEL
My liberty.
PROSPERO
Before the time be out? no more!
ARIEL
I prithee,
Remember I have done thee worthy service;
Told thee no lies, made thee no mistakings, served
Without or grudge or grumblings: thou didst promise
To bate me a full year.
PROSPERO
Dost thou forget
From what a torment I did free thee?
ARIEL
No.
PROSPERO
Thou dost, and think'st it much to tread the ooze
Of the salt deep,
To run upon the sharp wind of the north,
To do me business in the veins o' the earth
When it is baked with frost.
ARIEL
I do not, sir.
PROSPERO
Thou liest, malignant thing! Hast thou forgot
The foul witch Sycorax, who with age and envy
Was grown into a hoop? hast thou forgot her?
ARIEL
No, sir.
PROSPERO
Thou hast. Where was she born? speak; tell me.
ARIEL
Sir, in Argier.
PROSPERO
O, was she so? I must
Once in a month recount what thou hast been,
Which thou forget'st. This damn'd witch Sycorax,
For mischiefs manifold and sorceries terrible
To enter human hearing, from Argier,
Thou know'st, was banish'd: for one thing she did
They would not take her life. Is not this true?
ARIEL
Ay, sir.
PROSPERO
This blue-eyed hag was hither brought with child
And here was left by the sailors. Thou, my slave,
As thou report'st thyself, wast then her servant;
And, for thou wast a spirit too delicate
To act her earthy and abhorr'd commands,
Refusing her grand hests, she did confine thee,
By help of her more potent ministers
And in her most unmitigable rage,
Into a cloven pine; within which rift
Imprison'd thou didst painfully remain
A dozen years; within which space she died
And left thee there; where thou didst vent thy groans
As fast as mill-wheels strike. Then was this island--
Save for the son that she did litter here,
A freckled whelp hag-born--not honour'd with
A human shape.
ARIEL
Yes, Caliban her son.
PROSPERO
Dull thing, I say so; he, that Caliban
Whom now I keep in service. Thou best know'st
What torment I did find thee in; thy groans
Did make wolves howl and penetrate the breasts
Of ever angry bears: it was a torment
To lay upon the damn'd, which Sycorax
Could not again undo: it was mine art,
When I arrived and heard thee, that made gape
The pine and let thee out.
ARIEL
I thank thee, master.
PROSPERO
If thou more murmur'st, I will rend an oak
And peg thee in his knotty entrails till
Thou hast howl'd away twelve winters.
ARIEL
Pardon, master;
I will be correspondent to command
And do my spiriting gently.
PROSPERO
Do so, and after two days
I will discharge thee.
ARIEL
That's my noble master!
What shall I do? say what; what shall I do?
PROSPERO
Go make thyself like a nymph o' the sea: be subject
To no sight but thine and mine, invisible
To every eyeball else. Go take this shape
And hither come in't: go, hence with diligence!

Exit ARIEL

Awake, dear heart, awake! thou hast slept well; Awake!
MIRANDA
The strangeness of your story put
